headline.main: An Airman's Homecoming Adds Joy To the Day

lead_paragraph: JIM and Stephanie started dating at the tail end of the Persian Gulf war, and from the first they had an understanding: the Air Force could pull Jim away from her at any time. Like other military families, they learned to live with the uncertainty. The couple -- who on the advice of the military asked that their last name not be used, for reasons of security -- married five years ago and are now raising two boys in North Charleston, S.C., where Jim, a master sergeant, is stationed at Charleston Air Force Base. This Thanksgiving they learned another lesson about the Air Force: it could also, without warning, bring the family back together.
abstract: Air Force master sergeant gets to come home to Charleston, SC, for Thanksgiving after flying some of first missions over Afghanistan; photos (M)
